model.comment: SMD84 is a stationary decoder, but it can be programmed in the usual way

label.text: Use this number to set the address number
of the turnout the output is connected to.
The Custom Programmer format is recommended
Note: Changes to Option CVs are not recognized until SMD84 power is cycled.
Opt4 Enable gateway for DCC commands from track to bus
- Requires bus interface and DCC control to be enabled
Opt5 Enable transmit and receive on bus
Opt6 Enable receiving DCC commands from track
- When disabled, DCC gateway is disabled
Note: In a Digitrax system the bus is called LocoNet

display.tooltip: Required for ops mode
Sets the Ops Mode address

label.text: This is the same as a Loco address
Opt1 Send input state at power on
Opt2 Send output state at power on
Opt3 Send primary input state at Digitrax interrogation request
Opt4 Send output state at Digitrax interrogation request

display.tooltip: The decoder version number (read only)
The manufacturer's ID number (read only)
Determines the input address
Sends opposite switch state from previous send - Switch Request only
Configures the input for specific use
Inverts the normal state of Close when input goes hi
Configures the input stimulas

Number of the route 1-8

label.text: When a switch (turnout) throw command is issued that matches this address the SMD84 primary inputs are disabled.
When a close command is issued with this address the primary inputs are enabled.
This feature is useful for dispatcher control when the SMD84 primary inputs are used for local turnout control.

display.tooltip: Configures the output for specific use
Configures the output for specific use
Configures the output for specific use
Configures the output for specific use
Configures the output for specific use
Configures the output for specific use
Configures the output for specific use
Configures the output for specific use
Range 1-127

label.text: Sets the pulse length for outputs configured as Pulse
Duration in seconds = CV value times .256
The default value of 31 gives about 8 seconds
Sets the output state to always be the same at power on
Only applies if Option 2 is selected
Note: If a sensor message is selected to execute a route then
switch state c and t is used for sensor hi and lo respectively.
